009
010package imagingbook.common.filter.mask;
011
012/**
013 * Defines a circular mask with the specified radius. Mask values are 1 inside the radius, 0 outside. Mask dimensions
014 * are square and odd, the reference point is as the center.
015 *
016 * @author WB
017 */
018public class CircularMask extends BinaryMask {
019        
020        /**
021         * Constructor.
022         * @param radius the mask radius
023         */
024        public CircularMask(double radius) {
025                super(makeMask(radius));
026        }
027        
028        private static byte[][] makeMask(double radius) {
029                int center = Math.max((int) Math.ceil(radius), 1);
030                int width = 2 * center + 1;             // width/height of mask array
031                byte[][] mask = new byte[width][width]; // initialized to zero
032                double r2 = radius * radius + 1;        // add 1 to get mask shape similar to ImageJ
033                for (int i = 0; i < width; i++) {
034                        int x = i - center;
035                        for (int j = 0; j < width; j++) {
036                                int y = j - center;
037                                if (x*x + y*y <= r2) {
038                                        mask[i][j] = 1;
039                                }
040                        }
041                }
042                return mask;
043        }
044
045}
